com.pump.text

Class TextComponentHighlighter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pump.text.TextComponentHighlighter
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    JavaTextComponentHighlighter

    public abstract class TextComponentHighlighter
extends java.lang.Object
    This abstract helper class triggers certain methods as a JTextComponent is updated and constantly reapplies formatting rules and highlights.

    • Method Detail

      • refresh

        public void refresh(boolean invokeLater)
        Refresh the formatting and highlights.

        It is not necessary for you to invoke this directly, unless the formatting/highlighting rules have changed. For example, if you are highlighting text based on a search text field, and the user types in that field, then you should manually invoke this method. Ultimately calling this method will trigger other protected methods to help apply formatting.

        Parameters:
        invokeLater - if true then this refresh is queued up via SwingUtilities.invokeLater(), which may have the added benefit of coalescing redundant calls. If false then this is executed immediately. When in doubt, I recommend passing "true" here.

      • getTokens

        public Token[] getTokens(java.lang.String text,
                         boolean includeWhitespace)
        Return the Tokens that are parsed from this text. Because JavaParser.parse(..) can be expensive for complex code, this method caches some values. When possible you should avoid calling JavaParser.parse(..) and use this method instead.
        Parameters:
        text - the java source code to parse.
        includeWhitespace - true if WhitespaceTokens should be included, false if they should be stripped away.
        Returns:
        Return the Tokens that are parsed from this text.

      • documentTextChanged

        protected void documentTextChanged(boolean onlyCaretChanged)
        This method is called on the EDT after the text of the document is updated.

        Note this method is not called immediately, it is wrapped in a SwingUtilities.invokeLater(..). When you call textComponent.setText(..) for a 500-line block of text, our DocumentListener is notified 500 separate times about an update (because apparently each line is appended individually). So our listener coalesces these notifications and only calls this method once the EDT is responsive again.

      • isActive

        public boolean isActive()
        Return true if this highlighter is active.

        true if this highlighter is active.

        Parameters:

        selectionStart - the current selection start.
